5- Any Race preference?

If you answer these questions, we'll have a much clearer idea of the kind of character you want and it'll be much easier to build him for you. It's up to you to figure out what you want, preferably before asking for a build. Without information, there's nothing we can do. Think about it.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Weapon Master basically eats up your feats (has very heavy feat requirements) to give you Critical Hit enhancements and AB bonus when you're wielding your Weapon Of Choice. You can be a Longsword master, which will extend the Critical Hit range by 2 and add x1 multiplier for your longsword. After 10 Weapon Master levels, you'll gain +1 AB per every 3 levels of Weapon Master you take. Since Arelith is a level 30 server, you really won't be able to make the most out of the AB bonus it gives, as the maximum WM levels you can have is 19 (+3 AB with a Longsword). You also get 1 Bonus feat every 3 levels after 10.

Allright, a military man will be a highly-trained fighter, so a Weapon Master could fit quite well. As for a 3rd class, Rogue doesn't fit because you'll be Lawful, nor Bard because of alignment conflicts. The only 3 classes we can use for Tumble dumps are Harper Scout, Shadowdancer and Monk. From these, I think Harper Scout is the one that makes more RP sense. Let me cook something up for ya.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey Empyre!

This build looks extremely solid. I must say that this is one of the most optimized toons I have ever seen you build. Good job!

The only "problem" I see there is minor. These saves are still incredibly low, and you'll need to resort to immunities rather than have faith in them, so that bears the question: you're spending two feats on a build to improve saves and they are still very low. Isn't there anything better that you can do with these feats? Since Devcrit is off the table, our options have become extremely limited, and when we get heat from a mage throwing a spell at us with his 24-26 INT, we WILL FAIL our save on most occasions. We can't use any scrolls due to our lack of UMD, and I don't even know how many are available anyway. I see two ways out of this:

1- We can take Called Shot / Toughness - We lose 3 Will, 1 Fort and 1 Reflex, we get 30 HP and the ability to lower enemy AB or AC (CS Arm lowers AB / CS Leg lowers AC).

2- We can also consider Disarm / Improved Disarm, but that has the problem of taking 6 points out of our AB and the fact that Longsword is a one-handed weapon. Still, it's a valid choice.

Other than that, seems like a very proficient fighter!

Take it EZ!

This build looks extremely solid. I must say that this is one of the most optimized toons I have ever seen you build. Good job!

The only "problem" I see there is minor. These saves are still incredibly low, and you'll need to resort to immunities rather than have faith in them, so that bears the question: you're spending two feats on a build to improve saves and they are still very low. Isn't there anything better that you can do with these feats? Since Devcrit is off the table, our options have become extremely limited, and when we get heat from a mage throwing a spell at us with his 24-26 INT, we WILL FAIL our save on most occasions. We can't use any scrolls due to our lack of UMD, and I don't even know how many are available anyway. I see two ways out of this:

1- We can take Called Shot / Toughness - We lose 3 Will, 1 Fort and 1 Reflex, we get 30 HP and the ability to lower enemy AB or AC (CS Arm lowers AB / CS Leg lowers AC).

2- We can also consider Disarm / Improved Disarm, but that has the problem of taking 6 points out of our AB and the fact that Longsword is a one-handed weapon. Still, it's a valid choice.

Other than that, seems like a very proficient fighter!

Take it EZ!
In light I went with it, it was a lot of fun, got to level 13, then Oh so my lovely luck the same drow IC captured me, and then shortly after (two dead drow later) I got sacrificed again...to oh but the same god, onto the same altar, I feel like I'm some type of. sacrificing guy xD

Couldn't agree more. If you yourself saw a gang of really rugged-looking individuals who look MUCH stronger than you, would you stand your ground or run? Unless your toon has 6 INT, he will notice that he has no chance of winning and have enough appreciation for his life to live to fight another day, just like Aragorn and Théoden did in LOTR - The Two Towers.

But, no mistake is a waste if you learn from it, so, it's not all that grim!

Take it EZ!
